result.execSummary:
The defendant Debra A. RAMIREZ was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotic (Hydrocodone) [Modifiers: Possession with Intent to Deliver/Distribute a Controlled Substance On or Near a School], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample.

Take all medications as prescribed.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Order Granting Furlough.
It is ordered that the defendant be granted a furlough from the Manitowoc County Jail for a term of three (3) months.  Consideration for an extension may be made by the court upon request from the defendant.  Furlough would commence on 06-16-16 upon judge's signature and she would report back to jail on 09-16-16 by 1200 hours/noon.
Copy delivered to jail.

Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to count 1, deliver Hydrocodone within 1000 feet of park.  Convicted.

Status conference at 04-30-2015 08:30 am

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant waives her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.   Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.   
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-26-15 at 3:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 02-25-15 at 3:30 p.m.
Minutes.
Brian Van Ells, through public defender.
Affidavit of Detective Adam Sohlden, Manitowoc City Police Department.
At 10:56 a.m., search warrant with return of officer thereon.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of two counts deliver schedule II narcotics within 1000 feet of school and 2 counts bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-23-15 at 2:30 p.m. Bail is set at $7,500.00 cash with the conditions that she report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.   Bail not furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
